verses.kjv: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:
verses.ct: After traveling through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they arrived in Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

verses.kjv: And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,
verses.ct: As was his usual practice, Paul went to the synagogue and for 3 Sabbath days discussed the scriptures with the people there.

verses.kjv: Opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.
verses.ct: He explained and demonstrated that the Christ had to suffer and rise from the dead, and he told them, 'This Jesus I'm telling you about — he is the Christ.'

verses.kjv: And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.
verses.ct: Some of them were convinced and joined Paul and Silas, along with a large number of God-honoring Greeks and quite a few prominent women.

verses.kjv: But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
verses.ct: But the Jews who didn't believe became jealous. They recruited some troublemakers from the streets, formed a mob, and threw the city into chaos. They stormed Jason's house, trying to drag Paul and Silas out to the crowd.

verses.kjv: And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;
verses.ct: When they couldn't find them, they dragged Jason and some other brothers before the city officials, shouting, 'These men who have been causing upheaval all over the world have now come here too,

verses.kjv: Whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.
verses.ct: and Jason has welcomed them into his home! They all defy the emperor's decrees by claiming there is another king — someone named Jesus.'

verses.kjv: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.
verses.ct: The crowd and the city officials were deeply disturbed when they heard these accusations.

verses.kjv: And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.
verses.ct: After making Jason and the others post bail, they released them.

verses.kjv: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews.
verses.ct: That very night, the brothers sent Paul and Silas off to Berea. When they arrived, they went to the Jewish synagogue.

verses.kjv: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.
verses.ct: The people in Berea were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica. They eagerly welcomed the message and examined the scriptures every day to verify what Paul was saying.

verses.kjv: Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.
verses.ct: As a result, many of them became believers, including a significant number of prominent Greek women and men.

verses.kjv: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.
verses.ct: But when the Jews in Thessalonica learned that Paul was proclaiming God's word in Berea, they went there too and started agitating the crowds.

verses.kjv: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.
verses.ct: The brothers immediately sent Paul toward the coast, but Silas and Timothy stayed behind in Berea.

verses.kjv: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.
verses.ct: Those escorting Paul brought him all the way to Athens. Before leaving, they carried back instructions for Silas and Timothy to join him as quickly as possible.

verses.kjv: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.
verses.ct: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, he was deeply troubled to see that the city was full of idols.

verses.kjv: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.
verses.ct: So he debated in the synagogue with the Jews and God-honoring Greeks, and every day in the marketplace with whoever happened to be there.

verses.kjv: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.
verses.ct: Some Epicurean and Stoic philosophers began engaging with him. Some asked, 'What is this rambling fool trying to say?' Others remarked, 'He seems to be promoting foreign gods' — because he was proclaiming the good news about Jesus and the resurrection.

verses.kjv: And they took him, and brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, is?
verses.ct: They brought him to the Areopagus and said, 'Can you explain this new teaching you're presenting?

verses.kjv: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.
verses.ct: You're introducing some unusual ideas to us, and we'd like to understand what they mean.'

verses.kjv: (For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)
verses.ct: (All the Athenians and the foreigners living there spent their time doing nothing but discussing or listening to the latest ideas.)

verses.kjv: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars’ hill, and said, Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.
verses.ct: Paul stood up in the middle of the Areopagus and said, 'People of Athens, I can see that you are extremely religious in every way.

verses.kjv: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.
verses.ct: As I walked around and observed your objects of worship, I even found an altar with this inscription: TO AN UNKNOWN GOD. What you worship without knowing — that is what I am going to explain to you.

verses.kjv: God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;
verses.ct: The God who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth, and he does not live in temples built by human hands.

verses.kjv: Neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;
verses.ct: He isn't served by human hands as if he needed anything, since he himself gives everyone life, breath, and everything else.

verses.kjv: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;
verses.ct: From one man he made every nation of people to live across the entire earth, and he set the specific times and boundaries for where they would live.

verses.kjv: That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:
verses.ct: He did this so that people would search for the Lord, and perhaps reach out for him and find him — even though he is not far from any one of us.

verses.kjv: For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.
verses.ct: For in him we live, move, and exist. As some of your own poets have written, "We are also his children."

verses.kjv: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man’s device.
verses.ct: Since we are God's children, we shouldn't imagine that the divine nature is anything like gold, silver, or stone — an image shaped by human skill and imagination.

verses.kjv: And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:
verses.ct: In the past, God overlooked such ignorance, but now he commands everyone everywhere to turn away from their sins.

verses.kjv: Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead.
verses.ct: He has set a day when he will judge the world with justice through a man he has appointed. He has given proof of this to everyone by raising that man from the dead.'

verses.kjv: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of this matter.
verses.ct: When they heard about the resurrection of the dead, some laughed at him, while others said, 'We'd like to hear more about this another time.'

verses.kjv: So Paul departed from among them.
verses.ct: With that, Paul left the council.

verses.kjv: Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
verses.ct: However, some people joined him and believed. Among them were Dionysius, a member of the Areopagus, a woman named Damaris, and several others.
